item.title: Forced Chat Text
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Looking around in the client I saw this:

if ((updateFlag & 0x10) != 0) {
    String chatText = class50_sub1_sub2.getString();
    if (chatText.charAt(0) == '~') {
        chatText = chatText.substring(1);
        sendMessage(player.getUsername(), chatText, 2);
    }
    else if (player == GameClient.currentPlayer) {
        sendMessage(player.getUsername(), chatText, 2);
    }
    // Rest is omitted.
}

What exactly is the purpose of the ‘~’ key preceding a message? There is no special processing that goes on afterwards.
